intro: Hieraciodes heterotricha, commonly known as the hairy goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieraciodes heterotricha is adapted to poor soils and can thrive in disturbed habitats.
